t: Exodus 15
The Song of Moses and Israel
Then*p Moses and the sons of Israel sang this song to the Lord,*s and said, “I*pn will sing to the Lord,*s for He is highly exalted; The*ln horse and its rider He has hurled into the sea.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and song, And*ln He has become my salvation; This*ln is my God, and I will praise Him; My*ln father’s God, and I will extol Him.
The*ln Lord*s is a warrior; The*ln Lord*s is His name.
Pharaoh’s*ln chariots and his army He has cast into the sea; And*ln the choicest of his officers are drowned in the Red Sea.
The*ln deeps cover them; They*ln went down into the depths like a stone.
Your*ln right hand, O Lord,*s is majestic in power, Your*ln right hand, O Lord,*s shatters the enemy.
And*ln in the greatness of Your excellence You overthrow those who rise up against You; You*ln send forth Your burning anger, and*i it consumes them as chaff.
At*ln the blast of Your nostrils the waters were piled up, The*ln flowing waters stood up like a heap; The*ln deeps were congealed in the heart of the sea.
The*ln enemy said, ‘I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; My*ln desire shall be gratified against them; I*ln will draw out my sword, my hand will destroy them.’
You*ln blew with Your wind, the sea covered them; They*ln sank like lead in the mighty waters.
Who*ln is like You among the gods, O Lord?*s Who*ln is like You, majestic in holiness, Awesome*ln in praises, working wonders?
You*ln stretched out Your right hand, The*ln earth swallowed them.
In*ln Your lovingkindness You have led the people whom You have redeemed; In*ln Your strength You have guided them*i to Your holy habitation.
The*ln peoples have heard, they tremble; Anguish*ln has gripped the inhabitants of Philistia.
Then*ln the chiefs of Edom were dismayed; The*ln leaders of Moab, trembling grips them; All*ln the inhabitants of Canaan have melted away.
Terror*ln and dread fall upon them; By*ln the greatness of Your arm they are motionless as stone; Until*ln Your people pass over, O Lord,*s Until*ln the people pass over whom You have purchased.
You*ln will bring them and plant them in the mountain of Your inheritance, The*ln place, O Lord,*s which You have made for Your dwelling, The*ln sanctuary, O Lord, which Your hands have established.
The*ln Lord*s shall reign forever and ever.”

For*p the horses of Pharaoh with his chariots and his horsemen went into the sea, and the Lord*s brought back the waters of the sea on them, but the sons of Israel walked on dry land through the midst of the sea.
Miriam*p the prophetess, Aaron’s sister, took the timbrel in her hand, and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dancing.
Miriam answered them, “Sing*pn to the Lord,*s for He is highly exalted; The*ln horse and his rider He has hurled into the sea.”
The Lord Provides Water
Then*p Moses led Israel from the Red Sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
When they came to Marah, they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were bitter; therefore it was named Marah.
So the people grumbled at Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”

Then he cried out to the Lord,*s and the Lord*s showed him a tree; and he threw it*i into the waters, and the waters became sweet. There*bp He made for them a statute and regulation, and there He tested them.

And He said, “If you will give earnest heed to the voice of the Lord*s your God, and do what is right in His sight, and give ear to His commandments, and keep all His statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you which I have put on the Egyptians; for I, the Lord,*s am your healer.”
Then*p they came to Elim where there were*i twelve springs of water and seventy date palms, and they camped there beside the waters.
